topic.title: Importing a class from the web using a URLClassLocator

keywords.keyword: Importing a class from the web using a URLClassLocator

para.text: Importing a class from the web using a URLClassLocator

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:9px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: While the previous example was able to load a class from the local file system, if you want to load a class across the web using HTTP then you'll need a

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: . Let's try to dynamically load the Scribble applet from the Object Arts website. Once again, you must make sure the Scribble package had been uninstalled from your development

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:7px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: And again, inspecting the state of the imported packages and classes can often be instructive.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:7px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:14px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: If you follow through the code in

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: you'll soon find that it's the method #

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: : that is actually responsible for downloading the binary package file across the web. Once received, the file is cached in your local web browser cache so (depending on your cache settings) subsequent attempts to load the package may not need to re-download the file.
